website_summaries.verdict: A solid, durable option in infant spoons from a trusted brand
pros: Customers appreciate the bright colors that make mealtimes for baby fun, as well as the safe silicone-tip design and good size that holds just the right amount of food
The longer handled design is best for caregivers feeding babies
cons: A few felt the spoon was too small
may not be the best option for self-feeders

customer_reviews.title: Small but Durable
customer_reviews.text: The spoon is small, narrow, has a thick silicone covering and lacks a significant bowl. These qualities have their pros and cons. Functionally the shape is easy to navigate into baby's mouth (almost despite being so thick/tall). However, runny liquids will readily spill off the sides. The spoon is ideal with yogurts or thicker foods, but proved almost unusable with thinner early stage foods (you have to administer very small spoonfuls). From a maintenance perspective, however, these are almost ideal. The design appears capable of withstanding whatever the dishwasher can throw at it. If you accept that there is no one perfect spoon, this is a great choice for foods with a thicker consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: A bit too thick
customer_reviews.text: My baby has a hard time with these since they are so thick. She ends up knocking food off the spoon with her upper lip, even with her mouth open. The silicone is rough in spots making it difficult to clean. I don't know if these are different than the 4 pack Nuk brand I saw in our local warehouse store, but these cost more per spoon. I don't know that these are worth the cost. The other spoons in the picture are Boon and Munchkin.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Nice for beginner feeder but as soon as the baby ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice for beginner feeder but as soon as the baby gets the hang of eating, the spoons are just too small. Ours is a hungry one and I can't keep up scooping up the food. Otherwise, I love the covered tips, the size and width of the spoon, and the length of the spoon. When he chomps down with his gums, not once has he been in pain due to covered tips. He even uses the spoon as a chewie sometimes to rub his gums on the spoon. Only reason I give 4 stars is that already a month into using them, I am looking for bigger spoons.
customer_reviews.author: APC

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Knockoff
customer_reviews.text: These are clearly a knockoff. When compared to a store bought Gerber spoon (see photos) the shape is different, both in the handle and the spoon head, and the silicone is rough and peeling. These are not safe to feed a child with.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ewing

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Handle
customer_reviews.text: These spoons have a curve to the handle which at first I thought I would hate but it actually makes it much easier to hold and feed my baby with. These are great and I highly recommend them! The two pack is especially nice if you are a butterfingers long me and drop things all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not the same
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they look like the ones I had before and when I got them they are not the same tho it may look the same but the rubber it's not the same and it looks very unsafe as to the rubber looks like it's peeling off which is scary!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Best beginner spoons
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after I used one from a friend. They are a million times better than the ones we had. Since there is no “lip” on these, my son gets all of the food in his mouth with minimal mess around his face because I don’t have to try and help him get the food off the spoon. Hands down, the best and I won’t use any others now.
customer_reviews.author: Bmoney

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but must hand wash
customer_reviews.text: The spoons are great, except I must hand wash. They taste very soapy after going through the dishwasher (and take repeated soaks and washes to lose the soapy taste). Otherwise, I’m a fan of these for feeding baby.
customer_reviews.author: Sharha

customer_reviews.title: These are great baby spoons
customer_reviews.text: These are great baby spoons. The curved metal handle is comfortable and durable but the soft tip protects little tots mouth and teeth. I love that they come in many colors. Overall a great first spoon!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Thick silicone spoon
customer_reviews.text: I love the older version of spoons..... unsure why they now make them so thick! My 7mth old's mouth is small and it gets so messy trying to get it into her mouth!
customer_reviews.author: roseangellove99

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly sized spoons
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are my favorite for feeding. They're shaped like a baby's mouth, NOT thick and fat like plastic type. Perfect for getting first spoonfuls into baby's mouth and "shaving" the spit out off her cheeks!
customer_reviews.author: Cheezgrl

customer_reviews.title: Great Spoons for an Aging Cat
customer_reviews.text: WE use these spoons to feed our 20 plus year old Siamese. These spoons offer just the right amount of food and will not hurt him if he decides to bite. Overall a good pet choice utensil!
customer_reviews.author: Quality 1

customer_reviews.title: great supplement for grannies
customer_reviews.text: by the time your grandchildren are visiting you, all those "baby forks and spoons" from your own children have been either tossed or lost, and that "ceremonial silver spoon" is not one you want to use for a little one. These spoons are perfect. Great price point, dishwasher safe (if you choose) - soft bowl and edges designed not to hurt baby. And several in a pack! So you won't have to go digging for the one baby spoon you want - unless you have someone who only wants a particular color - which little babies are not usually so interested in - well worth the price
customer_reviews.author: D. wood

customer_reviews.title: Work Well
customer_reviews.text: These fit into small mouths and can be easily cleaned. Our granddaughter loves using them herself. Just the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Doss

customer_reviews.title: Good spoon at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Allows one to stick up and not have to wash a single expensive spoon five times a day. My son prefers another spoon over this one, he's only between 4-5 months. I know as a toddler these will be fine though. They hold up in the dishwasher, so zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: quesolover

customer_reviews.title: Highly Suggest These Spoons
customer_reviews.text: These spoons were great to use when feeding my teething daughter. The soft part on the spoon made it comfortable for my child to gnaw on them as she ate food. I didn't have to worry about the metallic taste or sharper edges. They were well used throughout our transition to table foods and only stopped when we passed them along to a new mom.
customer_reviews.author: atchleya

customer_reviews.title: Good little spoons.
customer_reviews.text: Good for feeding and teething baby. My son loves to chew on them. Make sure you watch them if you let them chew on it, they could gag themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality -- Initial Quality Upon Inspection Prior to Use
customer_reviews.text: The rubber/plastic on the actual spoon looks poorly made. I don't think I even used them. When I attemp to use them, I end up just getting other spoon brands that I already have or that I purchased when I got these.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. F

customer_reviews.title: Not good spoons
customer_reviews.text: These suck and are going in my garage sale. They do not scrape the food out of baby jars very well and do not hold much food. Food is likely to drip off of these. The curved handle is annoying also. Search for silicone spoons on Amazon instead.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Holding up to biting - Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Product has held up well for the month the spoons have been in use. They seem to take chewing better than other versions of this spoon. At this point I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Snaggle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for parents
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for parents, grandparents, and babysitters to hold and slip in the tiny amounts of baby's first foods. Good curve, nice silicone covered spoon head, and the perfect shape for quickly getting in and out of baby's mouth and then getting a quick clean-up swipe of anything that dribbles out.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: So far seem okay
customer_reviews.text: The rubber coating on the tips are thick and seem durable but one of them had some of the rubber coming off right out of the package. They work well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie K.

customer_reviews.title: Strong chemical smell did not keep them
customer_reviews.text: We got these, the munchkin 6 pack of spoons and the Oxo spoons for our twin boys. The Oxo spoons are the best which was not a surprise given they cost so much more but these were really terrible. The chemical smell on these was terrible we returned the. This was after hand washing them in hot water with soap. They also had these black greasy smudges on them that didn't totally come off with washing. It did not seem safe to use these much less use them for my babies.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: perfect spoon for babies!
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw the pointy design of the spoon, it looked a bit odd compared with the spoons I used for my older two kids. It turns out the pointy, thick design is perfect for babies and I have been so glad I found these spoons!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Food gets stuck where the spoon meets the handle. Small surface area on spoon, only good for the first few months of eating solids. Somewhat flat scoop as well. Good for 6-9 months or until they really get into solids more.
customer_reviews.author: allie

customer_reviews.title: Not real
customer_reviews.text: These are FAKE. I have the real ones and lost two (it’s a four pack), so I needed more. They didn’t have them at Buy Buy Baby; I turned to Amazon. Upon opening the package I realized they were a copy and discarded them. I would not put them near my child as they are not safe!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Spoons!
customer_reviews.text: I have three children and have used these spoons with every one. They are the perfect size for beginning eaters and will keep the food on as long as you're not trying to pile a huge heap of cereal on it. I've never really had a problem with the food not staying on. I like that the well isn't deep; it makes it easier to place in my baby's mouth. They also make Gerber spoons that are the same "Soft Bite" material, but wider for bigger spoonfuls. Overall, I really love these spoons!
customer_reviews.author: NiftyNest

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, cheap rubber. We received these and the rubber tips were already peeling before we even took them out of the box. Nock-offs. Not safe to use. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good for multiple ages
customer_reviews.text: Great for multiple aged children. Both 6 month old and 2 year old love them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McMorrow

customer_reviews.title: They don't list the dimensions.
customer_reviews.text: You didnt list dimensions. I wanted these for spice scoops. Cant tell how shallow the bowl is nor how thick the spoon sides from the pics. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: SoftailCarrie

customer_reviews.title: Starting foods at 4 months and my baby loves to ...
customer_reviews.text: Starting foods at 4 months and my baby loves to chew on the soft tips. They held up in the dishwasher very well. Thank you Gerber!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Davis

customer_reviews.title: good enough
customer_reviews.text: these are fine spoons however the rubber when I got it was coming off. I had to pull off extra rubber before I could use them
customer_reviews.author: Christina Bergeron

customer_reviews.title: ... the spoons because my mom has them and I liked them. But when my set arrived
customer_reviews.text: Bought the spoons because my mom has them and I liked them. But when my set arrived, there are all these peices of loose rubber on the spoons I am scratching off before I let her use them
customer_reviews.author: K&A12

customer_reviews.title: My favorite baby spoon so far!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old son has used this since he started solids 2 months ago. We tried some others, but we both prefer these. The shallowness of the spoon is great for babies who are just learning to eat with one. And the softness of the head is perfect for babies to chew on. My son could always easily grasp the spoon and chew on it in between bites and I think it made him feel like he was helping. I think these help contribute to a positive experience learning to eat!
customer_reviews.author: TartanCat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my granddaughter who just started eating.
customer_reviews.text: Theses are exactly what I was looking for. My granddaughter just started eating soft foods, perfect size and will work great when she starts teething thanks to the rubberized spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Rangermoed

customer_reviews.title: Love these. They have just the right amount of ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these. They have just the right amount of dish in the spoon that it's easy to get my daughter to clean everything off of it with each bite. Other spoons I've used are dished too deep and a lot of food is left behind after each bite. The soft rubber coating makes it easy on her teeth and keeps me from stabbing her in the gums with hard metal when I inevitably miss.
customer_reviews.author: RandR10

customer_reviews.title: Good size and quality
customer_reviews.text: My son is 6 months old and just started eating solids. The size of these spoons are perfect for tiny mouths. The tip of the spoon is tapered so that you can get as little (or as much) as you want on the spoon. The sides are a bit flatter so I use that to scoop up left overs on his face and lips. The quality is very good and looks as if it'll last forever. The set I got had green, blue, and orange spoons in it, which was perfect for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine

customer_reviews.title: I like the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the price, color, size and materials however I don't much care for the thickness of the spoon. It's too bulky, hard to "scrape" the food off the baby's face when dribbling. Wish the silicone part was not so clunky.
customer_reviews.author: Boodi

customer_reviews.title: Baby spoons
customer_reviews.text: My Granddaughter loves them for her baby boy.She said these spoons make it easier to feed him, because of the shape and size of the spoon and the shape of the handle.
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: My favorite baby spoons
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has pointed tip and doesn’t have edges allowing baby to clean spoon and no food stuck behind. Does not stain
customer_reviews.author: anne

customer_reviews.title: very durable
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are perfect for your starting feeder. We've been using them for awhile on our teething baby, and even though he has lots of teeth and likes to bite down on them when feeding (I think the rubber feels good on his gums,) there are no dents or gauges in the rubber. Great product that will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JasonTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Not up to the usual standards
customer_reviews.text: These spoons were not the quality I’d expect from Gerber. The plastic coating ripped almost immediately. My kid doesn’t even have enough teeth to make that happen. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Tate

customer_reviews.title: Probably more of a personal preference, but I much ...
customer_reviews.text: Probably more of a personal preference, but I much prefer this brand of spoon with a FLAT handle. This one is curved. Note, the spoon does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Willie P

customer_reviews.title: Great for infants!
customer_reviews.text: These sppons are great, and I definitely recommend them. As a new mom, I wasn't sure it was necessary to go with special covered spoons for my baby, but I am now a firm believer! My 4 month-old son bites down on the spoon when he gets excited and really likes what he is eating (bananas!!). I can definitely imagine his gums getting hurt if they weren't covered. All of the spoons have been used and washed multiple times now, with no problems what-so-ever! They are also the perfect size for baby feeding. Overally, I definitely recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: C. Starkey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to feed baby and easy for baby to grab to somewhat feed herself. Very safe for baby to chew on because of the rubber tips. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Kosik

customer_reviews.title: Great spoon for Baby's first spoon
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are great for a baby just beginning to eat food. They have a small spoon area so they fit baby's mouth well. One package is enough for us. I do believe baby will outgrow them quickly since he will need more of a toddler spoon when he gets a couple months older. These spoons wash up well, and we like the soft tip for baby's first spoon. I believe the soft tip feels better on his gums.
customer_reviews.author: Thurston

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly Sized
customer_reviews.text: These are fun and easy to use. My daughter loves these though she has some issues using them herself but to be fair she is only 11 months old. I love the silicone coating as they keep her teeth safe. They are the perfect size for feeding my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: I liked the idea of these classic metal spoons until my ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of these classic metal spoons until my child grabbed one. A little worried he's going to poke his eye out, but I think that might be an issue with every spoon. I like the coated spoon end as he often bites down while eating from these. It is nice to know his brand new teeth are safe.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Good spoons
customer_reviews.text: These are great when babies are small and starting to eat solids because they are really gentle on the gums. The only downside is that kids outgrow them pretty quickly as soon as they start eating more food (this only holds a small amount- great when they start solids but not so much a little later). Definitely by the time they have a few more teeth a spoon that holds more is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Patty1001

customer_reviews.title: Vibrant!
customer_reviews.text: These are the only spoons my son will use. I find them super easy to clean, it helps with teething since he likes to chew on them in between bites, they're very durable. I couldn't have found a better spoon for him! The colors are so vibrant and cute.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: not what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. They are not as pictured. Come to a point.
customer_reviews.author: lovedbyGod

customer_reviews.title: I love that these spoons have a narrower tip so it's ...
customer_reviews.text: I love that these spoons have a narrower tip so it's easier to get fed my 5 month old son. I like these much better than the wider mouth spoons. Also love that they're dishwasher safe!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Nice spoons for baby
customer_reviews.text: Got these and a couple of different kinds for my daughter when she was beginning to eat solids. These were by far my favorite for feeding her things like oatmeals, rice cereals, sticky-type foods, that they eat so much of in the beginning! The silicone tip is soft and they are affordable, so if you loose one (or a couple), it doesn't break the bank to replace them!
customer_reviews.author: A. D. Elswick

customer_reviews.title: nice, but I don't think you can select the color assortment you receive
customer_reviews.text: Cute spoons--nice size and nicely soft. But if ordering from Amazon, know that there doesn't seem to be a way to chose the colors you receive. I thought I was getting the ones in the product photo, but they came in "boy" colors of blues and greens. I wanted the pink and purple assortment. However, it wasn't worth returning. I needed the spoons and they're cute enough.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Good for little mouths and new teeth
customer_reviews.text: We like these because they fit in little mouths if you need to give an infant medicine, and are good for the initial solid food training. Later when they're getting teeth, I imagine these feel good on the teeth. Better to save the deep Munchkin spoons for later when they're a little more practiced at feeding themselves and won't get their mouths scraped on the edges of those spoons.
customer_reviews.author: Skeptical Shopper

customer_reviews.title: I really don't like that the spoons are so thick
customer_reviews.text: I really don't like that the spoons are so thick! I thought they were just normal sized spoons but the rubber part it pretty thick and I didn't like them. If I hadn't thrown away the packaging I'd return
customer_reviews.author: Angel Vega

customer_reviews.title: I really like them. The main difference is there's an angle ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a little different than the first Nuk/Gerber Graduates spoons that I purchased but so far, I really like them. The main difference is there's an angle to the spoon itself and to the tip to help you get the food from spoon to baby's mouth more easily. Really satisfied with this purchased and boy was the price right.
customer_reviews.author: Aliza HausmanTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Check before use
customer_reviews.text: One spoon had jagged edges on the metal next to the dipped plastic mouth piece and had to be tossed. The other 5 were fine, so buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: mernum

customer_reviews.title: They have a good shape and size
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are subpar. They have a good shape and size. But, the handle is too heavy. When I set it in the baby food, it falls out every time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: more then 1 use
customer_reviews.text: ok you won't be leave this i use them to feed a unhealthy pet lol my babes are 27 23 17 lol yes they work on my pets and my babes always used their hands lol funny huh was easier and fun to eat with their fingers i dare anyone to say theirs were different lol great spoons thou rubber on spoon no scraping of baby teeth
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY TELLS THE WAY IT IS AFTER USEING  GOOD OR BAD

customer_reviews.title: Ideally Good, but not well balanced and the spoon is shallow
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because it's BPA free, but was a bit disappointed with the shallowness of the spoon and the unbalanced hold. The handle is metal and thin, so it's not easy to hold on to (baby swats the spoon out of my hand easily); and you can't grab much of the food with the spoon. Unfortunately they're just sitting in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Ilona

customer_reviews.title: Nice Curves
customer_reviews.text: The spoon part has held up to much chewing from my toddlers, and I also really like the curve of the handle it helps them figure out how to hold it right side up.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Eyes

customer_reviews.title: Best spoon I have used yet for my kids for ...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about these since the spoon itself is bigger with the rubber on it. Best spoon I have used yet for my kids for feeding baby food which is watery and tends to be pushed off of a regular plastic spoon. My seven month old does a great job eating with these.
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: so soft and gentle on my baby's gums. love the colors
customer_reviews.author: Song Light

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. They have a major arch in the handle which makes it so much easier to feed them when they are learning.
customer_reviews.author: Saunte Robinson

customer_reviews.title: I used these for six months and the silicone plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: I used these for six months and the silicone plastic came off exposing the metal spoon. VERY DANGEROUS! Thankfully the plastic did not break off in my baby's mouth. I won't ever buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: So much easier to feed my son with these spoons vs plastic spoons. Well worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are just as expected from the product description, and have worked great in transitioning my son to soft foods. The soft silicone is gentle on his gums, and the spoons are good quality. I would recommend these to friends.
customer_reviews.author: B. Olson

customer_reviews.title: I love these spoons!
customer_reviews.text: Favortite spoon! I hate the baby using plastic so this is great. An extra bonus is that the spoon isn't deep so the food comes off great and doesn't get stuck in the spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K McDowell

customer_reviews.title: The rubber is kind of poorly cleaned up but it is fine.
customer_reviews.text: They do their job. The rubber is kind of poorly cleaned up but it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Spoon too flat for pureed foods
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are ok. I was excited about the soft tip especially since my daughter is teething, she enjoys sometimes just biting down on the spoon. But as far as feeding, the spoons are fairly flat, so it's really difficult to hold pureed items on it. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sapna

customer_reviews.title: The kid uses it, seems decent
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this set from amazon for my young son. My girlfriend approved the purchase and the kid actually uses them to eat his food, well, at least to transfer the food from whatever apparatus is holding it until it reaches his mouth. Have been using it for a while and they seem great. The spoon portion is nice and soft.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ruvio

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually a 23 year old woman, who just so happens to enjoy eating yogurt, ice cream, pudding, or any small soft served dish with a very small infant sized spoon..... and these ones are great (and adorable)! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic spoons!
customer_reviews.text: I used these with my first child almost 6 years ago, and I just got new ones. These are fantastic spoons and perfect for any stage food. Despite what other reviews say, they are not too shallow. You are not supposed to give them giant mouthfuls anyway! With my first I tried every other spoon out there, and these were her favorite. All the others are too hard...these have a nice soft end, which is perfect for those sensitive little gums. My oldest also liked to chew on these, with supervision of course. Take it from an experienced mom, these are great and go really well with the gerber bowls with lids!
customer_reviews.author: merebearsmommy

customer_reviews.title: Great for Babies
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect spoons. Saves the enamel on growing teeth.
customer_reviews.author: CrazyQT

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and I love the longer handle
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and I love the longer handle. Use them for many different things, not as baby spoons. They are great to use in jam jars, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Frenchfry

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for my baby but my toddler likes to bite the ends off.
customer_reviews.author: hopesallthings

customer_reviews.title: These multipacks are great to have extras on hand
customer_reviews.text: These multipacks are great to have extras on hand. Soft for the baby, easy to clean and we haven't experienced any issues with the silicone breaking down or peeling off.
customer_reviews.author: DV

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: These are the only spoons I've used to feed my 7 month old son. They are not so great with thinner, more liquidy foods, but not unusable. I've bought several packs because they work so well for us. My son enjoys playing with them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Great spoons! The bowl of the spoon is shallow and the bend in the handle gives great angles.
customer_reviews.text: Great spoons! The spoon is really shallow which helps so food doesn't get stuck in the bowl of the spoon. At first I thought the weird bend in them would bug me but it helps so much during feeding time.
customer_reviews.author: CAB

customer_reviews.title: Spoons for baby so baby can eat.
customer_reviews.text: A good spoon is not exactly rocket science. They hold the food, baby enjoys chewing on the soft texture, and they hold up well in the dishwasher so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable!
customer_reviews.text: These are our favorite baby spoons. My toddler even still loves them for things like yogurt. They are very durable, machine washable, and perfect for babies mouths. These are the only spoons we use now!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for children under a year old. Used these since our baby started eating baby food at 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these spoons! I love the rubber for gentle use and the colors just make them fun! Dishwasher safe and easy to toss in the diaper bag and go!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Beth Batson

customer_reviews.title: A little small
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality and would be perfect if not for the size. They are too small. Maybe for a small baby these would be great. They don't hold a lot of food.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: I like the curbed handles
customer_reviews.text: Not a very deep spoon, but it lets them get more food off! I like the curbed handles, it's easy to feed.
customer_reviews.author: B+R=K

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Product - Exactly What You'd Expect
customer_reviews.text: Great simple product for feeding baby. I have a few packs of these so that I can keep spares in the diaper bag, with daycare, etc. They work, they are easy to clean, and gentle on babies mouth. They aren't deep, but they are perfect for under a year old, because babies that age don't need adult size bites.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: I prefer all metal spoons. The silicon tip is ...
customer_reviews.text: I prefer all metal spoons. The silicon tip is very enticing for my 1 year old; he chews on it.
customer_reviews.author: Elin

customer_reviews.title: I have to watch her pretty closely.
customer_reviews.text: These are great- the only problem is that my 8 month old wants to chew on the metal part of the handle. I have to watch her pretty closely.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Bariatric Weight Loss Surgery
customer_reviews.text: I recently had weight loss surgery and these worked great for helping to take small bites post op. Plan to buy more. Also I wash them in the top rack of my dishwasher with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: A. E. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for 4-6 mo or baby’s just starting purées
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to clean! Dishwasher safe, which is a plus. My 5 month old loves to bite down on them. Feels good to her gums
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Decent.
customer_reviews.text: A little expensive... but gentle on sensitive baby gums. Compared to another spoon we use, these are more difficult to wash by hand, which we have to do because we have no dishwasher. We haven't been wowed by these, but not totally disappointed either.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Merkle

customer_reviews.title: Best baby food spoons
customer_reviews.text: These are super easy to feed baby food with. They aren't very deep, so it's easy for new eaters to get all the food off the end, unlike others that are so deep there is always baby food left on the spoon.
customer_reviews.author: SMF

customer_reviews.title: ... don't hold as much baby food as I would like. They are nice and sleek
customer_reviews.text: The spoons don't hold as much baby food as I would like. They are nice and sleek, but would be better if they were either slightly wider or deeper. I like our munchkin brand spoons better. Maybe these will be good for when baby starts feeding himself.
customer_reviews.author: Crissy Cates

customer_reviews.title: These work great! My son wouldn't eat his cereal and now ...
customer_reviews.text: These work great! My son wouldn't eat his cereal and now he will. He loves these spoons much more then the plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for grandson and my daughter's favorite spoon to feed him with.
customer_reviews.author: Kristal

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: The handle is great, but the spoon part is uneven and not very rounded and smooth. Not very happy with the quality at all :(
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had so many different spoons for kiddos over the years & my husband and I absolutely love these!! Best quality so far.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these and didn't realize the were a "pointed" tip. My 4 month old doesn't really care for them. I'm going to keep them as a spare and find them with the rounded top.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for first bites!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect first spoons for little mouths and sensitive gums! We may graduate to something else as my daughter gets bigger and continues to learn to eat, but I prefer these over every other spoon we have tried.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hallford

product_meta.title: Gerber Graduates Spoons BPA Free, Silicone, 4+ Months 6 ea
product_meta.description:
Gerber Graduates Spoons BPA Free, Silicone, 4+ Months 6 ea

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Gerber soft bite spoons for infants have a soft, silicone tip that is gentle on mouth and gums for babies learning to eat.
feature_bullets: Soft, silicone tip gentle on teeth and gums
Longer, curved handle makes feeding baby easier and more comfortable
